intro: Ilex venulosa, commonly known as the slender holly, is a species of evergreen shrub or small tree native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are glossy on top and lighter in color underneath. The plant produces small, dark red berries that are an important food source for various bird species. Ilex venulosa typically grows in moist, acidic soils and thrives in partial to full shade. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for landscaping in shaded garden settings.
